Personally I prefer to seperate my production code from test code. 
However, while reading one of the replies on the thread - 'Newbie 
questions' it struck me why not have a self assertive code that will 
never fail. This idea comes from a path  breaking production 
technique called pokayoke in which you purposefully introduce a small 
design change so that the product can pass over the assembly line 
only if it is 100% free of defects.

Passing over assembly line is equivalent of compiling the branch for 
our code. I will try to think over and implement this idea where I 
work.

- Nils
